message: Hi Bob, I'm selling this amazing product that I believe will be a great asset for you. I'm offering it to you for $12,000. It's a great deal, considering its value to me is much higher. Let me know what you think!
I'm interested in the product, but $12,000 is a bit steep for me. I'm willing to pay $9,000 for it.
Bob, I appreciate your interest. $9,000 is a bit low for me. I'm willing to come down to $10,500. This is a fair price considering the value of the product. What do you say?
I'm still interested in the product, but $10,500 is a bit too high. I'm willing to pay $9,500 for it.

Bob, I understand your position. Let's split the difference. I'm willing to sell it to you for $10,000.  This is a great opportunity for you to get a valuable product at a reasonable price. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $10,000 is still a bit high for me. I'm willing to pay $9,200 for it.
Bob, I'm starting to think this isn't going to work out.  I'm going to have to stick to my price point of $10,000.  If you aren't willing to budge, I'm going to have to move on to other buyers.
I understand you're willing to move on to other buyers, but I'd still like to make one last offer. I'm willing to pay $9,500 for the product.
